text: Bound for Glory () is a Canadian drama film, directed by Clément Perron and released in 1975."Première du film «Partis pour la gloire»". Bilan du siècle (Université de Sherbrooke). Set against the backdrop of the 1942 Canadian conscription plebiscite,Lever, Y. (2012). "Le cinéma québécois et la Seconde Guerre mondiale". Bulletin d'histoire politique, 20(3), 24–35. https://doi.org/10.7202/1056196ar. the film is set in a small town in the Beauce region of Quebec where resistance to the war is high and many men have fled into the woods to escape being conscripted."Clément Perron's Partis pour la gloire". Cinema Canada, February 1976. pp. 45-46. The film's cast includes Serge L'Italien, Rachel Cailhier, Jacques Thisdale, André Melançon, Yolande Roy, Jean-Marie Lemieux, Louise Ladouceur and Jean-Pierre Masson. Melançon won the Canadian Film Award for Best Actor at the 27th Canadian Film Awards.Maria Topalovich, And the Genie Goes To...: Celebrating 50 Years of the Canadian Film Awards.
